The quote attributed to Joe Paterno: When you get into the end zone, act like you've been there before," was popularized by White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci in July 2017.
There is debate about the true origin of: with some suggesting it may have been said by Vince Lombardi, Tom Landry, Paul Brown, Lou Holtz, or Paul William "Bear" Bryant.
Credible sources: such as Jack Ham and The New York Times, have attributed similar phrases to Joe Paterno, Lou Holtz, and Paul Brown.
Despite the lack of a definitive answer: the Washington Post has attributed the quote to Vince Lombardi in 1967.
